message: Hi Bob, I have an amazing product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $250.
I'm interested in the product, but $250 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $180 for it.
I understand that $180 is a bit lower than what I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm now offering the product for $220.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you consider $200?
I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $215.
I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you consider $195?
I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm not leaving money on the table. I'll sell the product to you for $205.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. Can you consider $185?
I'm getting close to my minimum price, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'll sell the product to you for $190.
I really want to make this deal happen, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you meet me at $180?
